member.name: T:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration
member.summary: Configuration options for .
member.remarks: Instances of are immutable once created. They can be created with the factory method , or using a builder pattern with or .

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.AllAttributesPrivate
member.summary: Whether or not user attributes (other than the key) should be private (not sent to the LaunchDarkly server).
member.remarks: By default, this is . If , all of the user attributes will be private, not just the attributes specified with or with the method.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.BackgroundPollingInterval
member.summary: The interval between feature flag updates when the application is running in the background.
member.remarks: This is only relevant on mobile platforms.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.BaseUri
member.summary: The base URI of the LaunchDarkly server.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: The connection timeout to the LaunchDarkly server.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.EnableBackgroundUpdating
member.summary: Whether to enable feature flag updates when the application is running in the background.
member.remarks: This is only relevant on mobile platforms.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.EvaluationReasons
member.summary: True if LaunchDarkly should provide additional information about how flag values were calculated.
member.remarks: The additional information will then be available through the client's "detail" methods such as . Since this increases the size of network requests, such information is not sent unless you set this option to .

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.EventCapacity
member.summary: The capacity of the event buffer.
member.remarks: The client buffers up to this many events in memory before flushing. If the capacity is exceeded before the buffer is flushed, events will be discarded. Increasing the capacity means that events are less likely to be discarded, at the cost of consuming more memory.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.EventFlushInterval
member.summary: The time between flushes of the event buffer.
member.remarks: Decreasing the flush interval means that the event buffer is less likely to reach capacity.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.EventsUri
member.summary: The base URL of the LaunchDarkly analytics event server.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.HttpMessageHandler
member.summary: The object to be used for sending HTTP requests, if a specific implementation is desired.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.InlineUsersInEvents
member.summary: Sets whether to include full user details in every analytics event.
member.remarks: The default is : events will only include the user key, except for one "index" event that provides the full details for the user.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.IsStreamingEnabled
member.summary: Whether or not the streaming API should be used to receive flag updates.
member.remarks: This is true by default. Streaming should only be disabled on the advice of LaunchDarkly support.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.MobileKey
member.summary: The key for your LaunchDarkly environment.
member.remarks: This should be the "mobile key" field for the environment on your LaunchDarkly dashboard.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.Offline
member.summary: Whether or not this client is offline. If , no calls to LaunchDarkly will be made.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.PersistFlagValues
member.summary: Whether the SDK should save flag values for each user in persistent storage, so they will be immediately available the next time the SDK is started for the same user.
member.remarks: The default is .

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.PollingInterval
member.summary: The polling interval (when streaming is disabled).

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.PrivateAttributeNames
member.summary: Attribute names that have been marked as private for all users.
member.remarks: Any users sent to LaunchDarkly with this configuration active will have attributes with this name removed, even if you did not use the method when building the user.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.ReadTimeout
member.summary: The timeout when reading data from the streaming connection.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.ReconnectTime
member.summary: The reconnect base time for the streaming connection.
member.remarks: The streaming connection uses an exponential backoff algorithm (with jitter) for reconnects, but will start the backoff with a value near the value specified here. The default value is 1 second.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.StreamUri
member.summary: The base URL of the LaunchDarkly streaming server.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.UseReport
member.summary: Whether to use the HTTP REPORT method for feature flag requests.
member.remarks: By default, polling and streaming connections are made with the GET method, witht the user data encoded into the request URI. Using REPORT allows the user data to be sent in the request body instead. However, some network gateways do not support REPORT.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.UserKeysCapacity
member.summary: The number of user keys that the event processor can remember at any one time.
member.remarks: The event processor keeps track of recently seen user keys so that duplicate user details will not be sent in analytics events.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.UserKeysFlushInterval
member.summary: The interval at which the event processor will reset its set of known user keys.

member.name: F:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.DefaultPollingInterval
member.summary: Default value for .

member.name: F:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.MinimumPollingInterval
member.summary: Minimum value for .

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.Default(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a configuration with all parameters set to the default.
member.param: the SDK key for your LaunchDarkly environment

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.Builder(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an for constructing a configuration object using a fluent syntax.
member.remarks: This is the only method for building a if you are setting properties besides the MobileKey. The has methods for setting any number of properties, after which you call to get the resulting Configuration instance.
member.param: the mobile SDK key for your LaunchDarkly environment

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.BuilderInternal(System.String)
member.summary: Exposed for test code that needs to access the internal methods of that are not in .
member.param: the mobile SDK key

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration.Builder(LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration)
member.summary: Creates an starting with the properties of an existing .
member.param: the configuration to copy

member.name: T:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder
member.summary: A mutable object that uses the Builder pattern to specify properties for a object.

remarks.para: Obtain an instance of this class by calling .
All of the builder methods for setting a configuration property return a reference to the same builder, so they can be chained together.

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.Build
member.summary: Creates a based on the properties that have been set on the builder. Modifying the builder after this point does not affect the returned .

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.AllAttributesPrivate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether or not user attributes (other than the key) should be private (not sent to the LaunchDarkly server).
member.remarks: By default, this is . If , all of the user attributes will be private, not just the attributes specified with or with the method.
member.param: true if all attributes should be private

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.BackgroundPollingInterval(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the interval between feature flag updates when the application is running in the background.
member.remarks: This is only relevant on mobile platforms. The default is ; the minimum is .
member.param: the background polling interval

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.BaseUri(System.Uri)
member.summary: Sets the base URI of the LaunchDarkly server.
member.param: the base URI

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.ConnectionTimeout(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the connection timeout for all HTTP requests.
member.remarks: The default value is 10 seconds.
member.param: the connection timeout

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.EnableBackgroundUpdating(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether to enable feature flag polling when the application is in the background.
member.remarks: By default, on Android and iOS the SDK can still receive feature flag updates when an application is in the background, but it will use polling rather than maintaining a streaming connection (and will use rather than ). If you set this property to false, it will not check for feature flag updates until the application returns to the foreground.
member.param: if background updating should be allowed

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.EvaluationReasons(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set to if LaunchDarkly should provide additional information about how flag values were calculated.
member.remarks: The additional information will then be available through the client's "detail" methods such as . Since this increases the size of network requests, such information is not sent unless you set this option to .
member.param: if evaluation reasons are desired

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.EventCapacity(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the capacity of the event buffer.
member.remarks: The client buffers up to this many events in memory before flushing. If the capacity is exceeded before the buffer is flushed, events will be discarded. Increasing the capacity means that events are less likely to be discarded, at the cost of consuming more memory.
member.param: the capacity of the event buffer

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.EventFlushInterval(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the time between flushes of the event buffer.
member.remarks: Decreasing the flush interval means that the event buffer is less likely to reach capacity. The default value is 5 seconds.
member.param: the flush interval

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.EventsUri(System.Uri)
member.summary: Sets the base URL of the LaunchDarkly analytics event server.
member.param: the events URI

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.HttpMessageHandler(System.Net.Http.HttpMessageHandler)
member.summary: Sets the object to be used for sending HTTP requests, if a specific implementation is desired.
member.remarks: This is exposed mainly for testing purposes; you should not normally need to change it. The default value is an , but if you do not change this value, on mobile platforms it will be replaced by the appropriate native HTTP handler for the current current platform, if any (e.g. Xamarin.Android.Net.AndroidClientHandler). If you set it explicitly to , the SDK will call the default constructor without specifying a handler, which may or may not result in using a native HTTP handler (depending on your application configuration).
member.param: the to use

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.InlineUsersInEvents(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether to include full user details in every analytics event.
member.remarks: The default is : events will only include the user key, except for one "index" event that provides the full details for the user.
member.param: true or false

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.IsStreamingEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether or not the streaming API should be used to receive flag updates.
member.remarks: This is by default. Streaming should only be disabled on the advice of LaunchDarkly support.
member.param: true if the streaming API should be used

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.MobileKey(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the key for your LaunchDarkly environment.
member.remarks: This should be the "mobile key" field for the environment on your LaunchDarkly dashboard.

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.Offline(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether or not this client is offline. If , no calls to LaunchDarkly will be made.
member.param: if the client should remain offline

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.PersistFlagValues(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether the SDK should save flag values for each user in persistent storage, so they will be immediately available the next time the SDK is started for the same user.
member.remarks: The default is .
member.param: to save flag values

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IConfigurationBuilder.PollingInterval(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the polling interval (when streaming is disabled).
member.remarks: The default is ; the minimum is .
member.param: the rule update polling interval

You may call this method repeatedly to mark multiple attributes as private.

member.name: T:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ConnectionManager
member.summary: Manages our connection to LaunchDarkly, if any, and encapsulates all of the state that determines whether we should have a connection or not.
member.remarks:
Whenever the state of this object is modified by , , , or , it will decide whether to make a new connection, drop an existing connection, both, or neither. If the caller wants to know when a new connection (if any) is ready, it should await the returned task.
The object begins in a non-started state, so regardless of what properties are set, it will not make a connection until after has been called.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ConnectionManager.ForceOffline
member.summary: True if we are in offline mode ( was set to true).

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ConnectionManager.NetworkEnabled
member.summary: True if we have been told there is network connectivity ( was set to true).

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ConnectionManager.Initialized
member.summary: True if we made a successful LaunchDarkly connection or do not need to make one (see ).

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ConnectionManager.SetForceOffline(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether the client should always be offline, and attempts to connect if appropriate.
member.remarks:
Besides updating the value of the property, we do the following:
If forceOffline is true, we drop our current connection (if any), and we will not make any connections no matter what other properties are changed as long as this property is still true.
If forceOffline is false and we already have a connection, nothing happens.
If forceOffline is false and we have no connection, but other conditions disallow making a connection (or we do not have an update processor factory), nothing happens.
If forceOffline is false, and we do not yet have a connection, and no other conditions disallow making a connection, and we have an update processor factory, we create an update processor and tell it to start.
The returned task is immediately completed unless we are making a new connection, in which case it is completed when the update processor signals success or failure. The task yields a true result if we successfully made a connection or if we decided not to connect because we are in offline mode. In other words, the result is true if is true.
member.param: true if the client should always be offline

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ConnectionManager.SetNetworkEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether we should be able to make network connections, and attempts to connect if appropriate.
member.remarks:
Besides updating the value of the property, we do the following:
If networkEnabled is false, we drop our current connection (if any), and we will not make any connections no matter what other properties are changed as long as this property is still true.
If networkEnabled is true and we already have a connection, nothing happens.
If networkEnabled is true and we have no connection, but other conditions disallow making a connection (or we do not have an update processor factory), nothing happens.
If networkEnabled is true, and we do not yet have a connection, and no other conditions disallow making a connection, and we have an update processor factory, we create an update processor and tell it to start.
The returned task is immediately completed unless we are making a new connection, in which case it is completed when the update processor signals success or failure. The task yields a true result if we successfully made a connection or if we decided not to connect because we are in offline mode. In other words, the result is true if is true.
member.param: true if we think we can make network connections

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ConnectionManager.SetUpdateProcessorFactory(System.Func{LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IMobileUpdateProcessor},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the factory function for creating an update processor, and attempts to connect if appropriate.
member.remarks:
The factory function encapsulates all the information that takes into account when making a connection, i.e. whether we are in streaming or polling mode, the polling interval, and the curent user. ConnectionManager itself has no knowledge of those things.
Besides updating the private factory function field, we do the following:
If the function is null, we drop our current connection (if any), and we will not make any connections no matter what other properties are changed as long as it is still null.
If it is non-null and we already have the same factory function, nothing happens.
If it is non-null and we do not already have the same factory function, but other conditions disallow making a connection, nothing happens.
If it is non-null and we do not already have the same factory function, and no other conditions disallow making a connection, we create an update processor and tell it to start. In this case, we also reset to false if resetInitialized is true.
The returned task is immediately completed unless we are making a new connection, in which case it is completed when the update processor signals success or failure. The task yields a true result if we successfully made a connection or if we decided not to connect because we are in offline mode. In other words, the result is true if is true.
member.param: a factory function or null
true if we should reset the initialized state (e.g. if we are switching users

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ConnectionManager.Start
member.summary: Tells the ConnectionManager that it can go ahead and connect if appropriate.
member.returns: a task which will yield true if this method results in a successful connection, or if we are in offline mode and don't need to make a connection

member.name: T:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.FeatureFlagEvent
member.summary: The IFlagEventProperties abstraction is used by LaunchDarkly.Common to communicate properties that affect event generation. We can't just have FeatureFlag itself implement that interface, because it doesn't actually contain its own flag key.

member.name: T:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.FlagChangedEventArgs
member.summary: An event object that is sent to handlers for the event.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.FlagChangedEventArgs.Key
member.summary: The unique key of the feature flag whose value has changed.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.FlagChangedEventArgs.NewValue
member.summary: The updated value of the flag for the current user.

remarks.para: Since flag values can be of any JSON type, this property is an . You can use properties and methods of such as to convert it to other types.
Flag evaluations always produce non-null values, but this property could still be if the flag was completely deleted or if it could not be evaluated due to an error of some kind.

Note that in those cases, the Variation methods may return a different result from this property, because of their "default value" behavior. For instance, if the flag "feature1" has been deleted, the following expression will return the string "xyz", because that is the default value that you specified in the method call:
But when an event is sent for the deletion of the flag, it has no way to know that you would have specified "xyz" as a default value when evaluating the flag, so will simply contain a .

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.FlagChangedEventArgs.OldValue
member.summary: The last known value of the flag for the current user prior to the update.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.FlagChangedEventArgs.FlagWasDeleted
member.summary: True if the flag was completely removed from the environment.

member.name: T:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient
member.summary: Interface for the standard SDK client methods and properties. The only implementation of this is .
member.remarks: See also , which provides convenience methods that build upon this interface.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.Initialized
member.summary: Returns a boolean value indicating LaunchDarkly connection and flag state within the client.

remarks.para: When you first start the client, once or has returned, should be if and only if either 1. it connected to LaunchDarkly and successfully retrieved flags, or 2. it started in offline mode so there's no need to connect to LaunchDarkly. If the client timed out trying to connect to LD, then is (even if we do have cached flags). If the client connected and got a 401 error, is . This serves the purpose of letting the app know that there was a problem of some kind.
If you call or , will become until the SDK receives the new user's flags.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.Offline
member.summary: Indicates whether the SDK is configured to be always offline.

remarks.para: This is initially if you set it to in the configuration with . However, you can change it at any time to allow the client to go online, or force it to go offline, using or .

When is , the SDK connects to LaunchDarkly if possible, but this does not guarantee that the connection is successful. There is currently no mechanism to detect whether the SDK is currently connected to LaunchDarkly.

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.SetOffline(System.Boolean,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets whether the SDK should be always offline.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to , but as a synchronous method.
If you set the property to , any existing connection will be dropped, and the method immediately returns .

If you set it to when it was previously , but no connection can be made because the network is not available, the method immediately returns , but the SDK will attempt to connect later if the network becomes available.

If you set it to when it was previously , and the network is available, the SDK will attempt to connect to LaunchDarkly. If the connection succeeds within the interval maxWaitTime, the method returns . If the connection permanently fails (e.g. if the mobile key is invalid), the method returns . If the connection attempt is still in progress after maxWaitTime elapses, the method returns , but the connection might succeed later.

member.param: true if the client should be always offline
the maximum length of time to wait for a connection
member.returns: true if a new connection was successfully made

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.SetOfflineAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether the SDK should be always offline.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to , but as an asynchronous method.
If you set the property to , any existing connection will be dropped, and the task immediately yields .

If you set it to when it was previously , but no connection can be made because the network is not available, the task immediately yields , but the SDK will attempt to connect later if the network becomes available.

If you set it to when it was previously , and the network is available, the SDK will attempt to connect to LaunchDarkly. If and when the connection succeeds, the task yields . If and when the connection permanently fails (e.g. if the mobile key is invalid), the task yields .

member.param: true if the client should be always offline
member.returns: a task that yields true if a new connection was successfully made

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.BoolVariation(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the boolean value of a feature flag for a given flag key.
member.param: the unique feature key for the feature flag
the default value of the flag
member.returns: the variation for the selected user, or defaultValue if the flag is disabled in the LaunchDarkly control panel

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.Track(System.String)
member.summary: Tracks that current user performed an event for the given event name.
member.param: the name of the event

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.Track(System.String,LaunchDarkly.Client.LdValue)
member.summary: Tracks that the current user performed an event for the given event name, with additional JSON data.
member.param: the name of the event
a JSON value containing additional data associated with the event

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.Track(System.String,LaunchDarkly.Client.LdValue,System.Double)
member.summary: Tracks that the current user performed an event for the given event name, and associates it with a numeric metric value.
member.remarks: As of this versions release date, the LaunchDarkly service does not support the metricValue parameter. As a result, calling this overload of Track will not yet produce any different behavior from calling without a metricValue. Refer to the SDK reference guide for the latest status.
member.param: the name of the event
a JSON value containing additional data associated with the event; pass if you do not need this value
this value is used by the LaunchDarkly experimentation feature in numeric custom metrics, and will also be returned as part of the custom event for Data Export

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.AllFlags
member.summary: Returns a map from feature flag keys to feature flag values for the current user.

remarks.para: If the result of a flag's value would have returned the default variation, the value in the map will contain . If the client is offline or has not been initialized, an empty map will be returned.
This method will not send analytics events back to LaunchDarkly.

member.returns: a map from feature flag keys to values for the current user

member.name: E:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.FlagChanged
member.summary: This event is triggered when the client has received an updated value for a feature flag.

remarks.para: This could mean that the flag configuration was changed in LaunchDarkly, or that you have changed the current user and the flag values are different for this user than for the previous user. The event is only triggered if the newly received flag value is actually different from the previous one.
The properties will indicate the key of the feature flag, the new value, and the previous value.

On platforms that have a main UI thread (such as iOS and Android), handlers for this event are guaranteed to be called on that thread; on other platforms, the SDK uses a thread pool. Either way, the handler is called called asynchronously after whichever SDK action triggered the flag change has already completed. This is to avoid deadlocks, in case the action was also on the main thread, or on a thread that was holding a lock on some application resource that the handler also uses.

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.Identify(LaunchDarkly.Client.User,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Changes the current user, requests flags for that user from LaunchDarkly if we are online, and generates an analytics event to tell LaunchDarkly about the user.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to , but as a synchronous method.

If the SDK is online, waits to receive feature flag values for the new user from LaunchDarkly. If it receives the new flag values before maxWaitTime has elapsed, it returns . If the timeout elapses, it returns (although the SDK might still receive the flag values later). If we do not need to request flags from LaunchDarkly because we are in offline mode, it returns .
If you do not want to wait, you can either set maxWaitTime to zero or call .

member.param: the new user
the maximum time to wait for the new flag values
member.returns: true if new flag values were obtained

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.IdentifyAsync(LaunchDarkly.Client.User)
member.summary: Changes the current user, requests flags for that user from LaunchDarkly if we are online, and generates an analytics event to tell LaunchDarkly about the user.

remarks.para: This is equivalent to , but as an asynchronous method.

If the SDK is online, the returned task is completed once the SDK has received feature flag values for the new user from LaunchDarkly, or received an unrecoverable error; it yields for success or for an error. If the SDK is offline, the returned task is completed immediately and yields .

member.param: the new user
member.returns: a task that yields true if new flag values were obtained

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient.Flush
member.summary: Tells the client that all pending analytics events should be delivered as soon as possible.

remarks.para: When the LaunchDarkly client generates analytics events (from flag evaluations, or from or ), they are queued on a worker thread. The event thread normally sends all queued events to LaunchDarkly at regular intervals, controlled by the option. Calling triggers a send without waiting for the next interval.
Flushing is asynchronous, so this method will return before it is complete. However, if you shut down the client with , events are guaranteed to be sent before that method returns.

member.name: T:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClientExtensions
member.summary: Convenience methods that extend the interface.
member.remarks: These are implemented outside of and because they do not rely on any implementation details of ; they are decorators that would work equally well with a stub or test implementation of the interface.

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClientExtensions.EnumVariation``1(LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient,System.String,``0)
member.summary: Equivalent to , but converts the flag's string value to an enum value.

remarks.para: If the flag has a value that is not one of the allowed enum value names, or is not a string, defaultValue is returned.

Note that there is no type constraint to guarantee that T really is an enum type, because that is a C# 7.3 feature that is unavailable in older versions of .NET Standard. If you try to use a non-enum type, you will simply receive the default value back.

member.param: the client instance
the unique feature key for the feature flag
the default value of the flag (as an enum value)
member.returns: the variation for the given user, or defaultValue if the flag cannot be evaluated or does not have a valid enum value

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClientExtensions.EnumVariationDetail``1(LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.ILdClient,System.String,``0)
member.summary: Equivalent to , but converts the flag's string value to an enum value.

remarks.para: If the flag has a value that is not one of the allowed enum value names, or is not a string, defaultValue is returned.

Note that there is no type constraint to guarantee that T really is an enum type, because that is a C# 7.3 feature that is unavailable in older versions of .NET Standard. If you try to use a non-enum type, you will simply receive the default value back.

member.param: the client instance
the unique feature key for the feature flag
the default value of the flag (as an enum value)

member.name: T:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IMobileUpdateProcessor
member.summary: Interface for an object that receives updates to feature flags, user segments, and anything else that might come from LaunchDarkly.

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IMobileUpdateProcessor.Start
member.summary: Initializes the processor. This is called once from the constructor.
member.returns: a Task which is completed once the processor has finished starting up

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.IMobileUpdateProcessor.Initialized
member.summary: Checks whether the processor has finished initializing.

member.name: T:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.NullUpdateProcessor
member.summary: Used when the client is offline or in LDD mode.

member.name: T:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.LdClient
member.summary: A client for the LaunchDarkly API. Client instances are thread-safe. Your application should instantiate a single LdClient for the lifetime of their application.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.LdClient.Instance
member.summary: The singleton instance used by your application throughout its lifetime. Once this exists, you cannot create a new client instance unless you first call on this one.
member.remarks: Use the static factory methods or to set this instance.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.LdClient.Version
member.summary: The current version string of the SDK.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.LdClient.Config
member.summary: The instance used to set up the LdClient.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.LdClient.User
member.summary: The current user for all SDK operations.
member.remarks: This is initially the user specified for or , but can be changed later with or .

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.LdClient.PlatformType
member.summary: Indicates which platform the SDK is built for.

remarks.para: This property is mainly useful for debugging. It does not indicate which platform you are actually running on, but rather which variant of the SDK is currently in use.

The LaunchDarkly.XamarinSdk package contains assemblies for multiple target platforms. In an Android or iOS application, you will normally be using the Android or iOS variant of the SDK; that is done automatically when you install the NuGet package. On all other platforms, you will get the .NET Standard variant.

The basic features of the SDK are the same in all of these variants; the difference is in platform-specific behavior such as detecting when an application has gone into the background, detecting network connectivity, and ensuring that code is executed on the UI thread if applicable for that platform. Therefore, if you find that these platform-specific behaviors are not working correctly, you may want to check this property to make sure you are not for some reason running the .NET Standard SDK on a phone.

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.LdClient.Init(System.String,LaunchDarkly.Client.User,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a new singleton instance and attempts to initialize feature flags.

remarks.para: In offline mode, this constructor will return immediately. Otherwise, it will wait and block on the current thread until initialization and the first response from the LaunchDarkly service is returned, up to the specified timeout. If the timeout elapses, the returned instance will have an property of .
If you would rather this happen asynchronously, use . To specify additional configuration options rather than just the mobile key, use or .
You must use one of these static factory methods to instantiate the single instance of LdClient for the lifetime of your application.

member.param: the mobile key given to you by LaunchDarkly
the maximum length of time to wait for the client to initialize

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.LdClient.InitAsync(System.String,LaunchDarkly.Client.User)
member.summary: Creates a new singleton instance and attempts to initialize feature flags asynchronously.

remarks.para: The returned task will yield the instance once the first response from the LaunchDarkly service is returned (or immediately if it is in offline mode).
You must use one of these static factory methods to instantiate the single instance of LdClient for the lifetime of your application.

member.param: the mobile key given to you by LaunchDarkly

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.LdClient.Init(LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration,LaunchDarkly.Client.User,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates and returns a new LdClient singleton instance, then starts the workflow for fetching Feature Flags.

remarks.para: In offline mode, this constructor will return immediately. Otherwise, it will wait and block on the current thread until initialization and the first response from the LaunchDarkly service is returned, up to the specified timeout. If the timeout elapses, the returned instance will have an property of .
If you would rather this happen asynchronously, use . If you do not need to specify configuration options other than the mobile key, you can use or .
You must use one of these static factory methods to instantiate the single instance of LdClient for the lifetime of your application.

member.param: The client configuration object
The user needed for client operations. Must not be null. If the user's Key is null, it will be assigned a key that uniquely identifies this device.
The maximum length of time to wait for the client to initialize. If this time elapses, the method will not throw an exception but will return the client in an uninitialized state.

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.LdClient.InitAsync(LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.Configuration,LaunchDarkly.Client.User)
member.summary:
Creates and returns a new LdClient singleton instance, then starts the workflow for fetching Feature Flags. This constructor should be used if you do not want to wait for the IUpdateProcessor instance to finish initializing and receive the first response from the LaunchDarkly service.
This is the creation point for LdClient, you must use this static method or the more basic to instantiate the single instance of LdClient for the lifetime of your application.
member.param: The client configuration object
The user needed for client operations. Must not be null. If the user's Key is null, it will be assigned a key that uniquely identifies this device.

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.LdClient.Dispose
member.summary: Permanently shuts down the SDK client.

remarks.para: This method closes all network collections, shuts down all background tasks, and releases any other resources being held by the SDK.
If there are any pending analytics events, and if the SDK is online, it attempts to deliver the events to LaunchDarkly before closing.

member.name: T:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This is the main namespace for the LaunchDarkly Xamarin SDK. You will most often use (the SDK client) and (configuration options for the client). The SDK also uses types from , such as .

member.name: T:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.PlatformType
member.summary: Values returned by .

member.name: F:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.PlatformType.Standard
member.summary: You are using the .NET Standard version of the SDK.

member.name: F:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.PlatformType.Android
member.summary: You are using the Android version of the SDK.

member.name: F:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.PlatformType.IOs
member.summary: You are using the iOS version of the SDK.

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.PlatformSpecific.Http.CreateHttpMessageHandler(System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: If our default configuration should use a specific implementation, returns that implementation.
member.remarks: The timeouts are passed in because the Xamarin Android implementation does not actually look at the configured timeouts from HttpClient.
member.returns: an HTTP handler implementation or null

member.name: M:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.PlatformSpecific.Http.TranslateHttpException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Converts any platform-specific exceptions that might be thrown by the platform-specific HTTP handler to their .NET equivalents.
member.remarks: We don't really care about specific network exception classes in our code, but in any case where we might expose the exception to application code, we want to normalize it to use only .NET classes.
member.param: an exception
member.returns: the same exception or a more .NET-appropriate one

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.PlatformSpecific.UserMetadata.DeviceName
member.summary: Returns the string that should be passed in the "device" property for all users.
member.returns: The value for "device", or null if none.

member.name: P:LaunchDarkly.Xamarin.PlatformSpecific.UserMetadata.OSName
member.summary: Returns the string that should be passed in the "os" property for all users.
member.returns: The value for "os", or null if none.

member.summary: This namespace contains types that are shared between the Xamarin and .NET SDKs, such as .
